cipher_text:
Encode the following text to a Caesar cipher. The shift is 6.
plain text: η καλοσύνη δεν κοστίζει τίποτα
plain text in ascii: \u03b7 \u03ba\u03bb\u03bf\u03b9\u03b7\u03b5 \u03b4\u03b5\u03bb\u03bd\u03b9\u03b1\u03b9\u03b1 \u03b4\u03b5\u03b3\u03b9\u03b1\u03b9\u03b4\u03b5\u03b1
I tried to do it like this:

plainText = "\u03b7 \u03ba\u03bb\u03bf\u03b9\u03b7\u03b5 \u03b4\u03b5\u03bb\u03bd\u03b9\u03b1\u03b9\u03b1 \u03b4\u03b5\u03b3\u03b9\u03b1\u03b9\u03b4\u03b5\u03b1"
def caesar_cipher(plainText, shift):
    cipherText = ""
    for char in plainText:
        if char.isalpha():
            ascii_offset = ord('a') if char.islower() else ord('A')
            encrypted_char = chr((ord(char) - ascii_offset + shift) % 26 + ascii_offset)
            cipherText += encrypted_char
        else:
            cipherText += char
    return cipherText
print(caesar_cipher(plainText, 6))

But I get the following error:

UnicodeEncodeError: 'charmap' codec can't encode character '\u03b7' in position 0: character maps to <undefined>

How can I solve this?
Comment: You can't use ord and chr on Unicode characters.
Comment: @Barmar I see, but how can I solve this?
Comment: You can use ord and chr on the UTF-8 encoding of the string.
Comment: @Barmar I don't understand, can you please give me an example?
Comment: @Barmar I tried to do it like this: plainText = "\u03b7 \u03ba\u03bb\u03bf\u03b9\u03b7\u03b5 \u03b4\u03b5\u03bb\u03bd\u03b9\u03b1\u03b9\u03b1 \u03b4\u03b5\u03b3\u03b9\u03b1\u03b9\u03b4\u03b5\u03b1".encode('utf-8') but I get the following error: TypeError: ord() expected string, bytes or integer, not bytes
Comment: You need to decode it back to a string after encoding.
Comment: @Barmar I tried to do it like this: plainText = "\u03b7 \u03ba\u03bb\u03bf\u03b9\u03b7\u03b5 \u03b4\u03b5\u03bb\u03bd\u03b9\u03b1\u03b9\u03b1 \u03b4\u03b5\u03b3\u03b9\u03b1\u03b9\u03b4\u03b5\u03b1".encode('utf-8').decode('utf-8') but I get the same error
Comment: You don't need to do that. Just encode it when you call ord(), and decode it when you call chr().
Comment: @Barmar I tried to do it like this: plainText = "\u03b7 \u03ba\u03bb\u03bf\u03b9\u03b7\u03b5 \u03b4\u03b5\u03bb\u03bd\u03b9\u03b1\u03b9\u03b1 \u03b4\u03b5\u03b3\u03b9\u03b1\u03b9\u03b4\u03b5\u03b1".encode('utf-8') and encrypted_char = chr(ord(char.encode('utf-8')) - ascii_offset + shift).decode('utf-8') but I get the following error: TypeError: ord() expected string, bytes or integer, not bytes
Comment: You need to decode it before calling ord().
Comment: @Barmar I tried to do it like this: encrypted_char = chr(ord(char.decode('utf-8')) - ascii_offset + shift).encode('utf-8') but I get the following error: UnicodeEncodeError: 'charmap' codec can't encode character '\u03b7' in position 0: character maps to
Comment: You need to encode it after adding the shift.
Comment: @Barmar I tried to do it like this: encrypted_char = chr(ord(char.decode('utf-8')) - ascii_offset + shift).encode('utf-8') but I get the following error: UnicodeEncodeError: 'charmap' codec can't encode character '\u03b7' in position 0: character maps to
Comment: You need to encode it after adding the shift, not before.
Comment: @Barmar I tried to do it like this: encrypted_char = chr(ord(char.decode('utf-8')) - ascii_offset + shift).encode('utf-8') but I get the following error: UnicodeEncodeError: 'charmap' codec can't encode character '\u03b7' in position 0: character maps to
Comment: You need to encode it after adding the shift, not before.
Comment: @Barmar I tried to do it like this: encrypted_char = chr(ord(char.decode('utf-8')) - ascii_offset + shift).encode('utf-8') but I get the following error: UnicodeEncodeError: 'charmap' codec can't encode character '\u03b7' in position 0: character maps to
Comment: You need to encode it after adding the shift, not before.
Comment: @Barmar I tried to do it like this: encrypted_char = chr(ord(char.decode('utf-8')) - ascii_offset + shift).encode('utf-8') but I get the following error: UnicodeEncodeError: 'charmap' codec can't encode character '\u03b7' in position 0: character maps to
Comment: You need to encode it after adding the shift, not before.
Comment: @Barmar I tried to do it like this: encrypted_char = chr(ord(char.decode('utf-8')) - ascii_offset + shift).encode('utf-8') but I get the following error: UnicodeEncodeError: 'charmap' codec can't encode character '\u03b7' in position 0: character maps to
